verb.description: Officially agree to or accept as satisfactory.
examples: the budget was approved by Congress
synonyms: give one's seal of approval to
give one's stamp of approval to

examples: he approved himself ripe for military command

origin: Middle English: from Old French aprover, from Latin approbare (see approbate). The original sense was prove, demonstrate, later corroborate, confirm, hence pronounce to be satisfactory ( late Middle English).
